cutscene.sp: Sora Riku! What’s the matter with you? What are you thinking? Don’t you realize what you’re doing?
Riku I was about to ask you the same thing, Sora. You only seem interested in running around and showing off that Keyblade these days. Do you even want to save Kairi?
Sora I do.

cutscene.desc: Pinocchio screams and they run into the Bowels. They find him trapped inside a large Parasite Cage Heartless. It swings its appendages when they enter, waiting for them to come near
cutscene.sp: Riku You up for this?

cutscene.desc: Sora assumes a fighting stance
cutscene.sp: Sora No problem. Let’s do it!
Pinocchio Get me out of here!

cutscene.desc: Sora attacks the small head attached to its arms as it swings the arms wildly. Riku runs behind it to avoid them and strikes. Sora leaps at it, while Donald sends a Thunder spell, but it lifts an arm and Sora crashes into it, falling to the damp floor
cutscene.sp: Pinocchio Help! It’s scary in here!

cutscene.desc: Sora attacks the bottom cage-like head of the Heartless where Pinocchio is trapped, but the beast will not budge. Its arms take out Goofy while Sora gives it an upward strike. It begins to wobble, grabbing the ceiling for balance, and spits out Pinocchio into a hole in the floor. Riku jumps in after him as the Heartless escapes. The water level in the mouth decreases as Sora, Donald, and Goofy land on the deck of Geppetto’s ship
cutscene.sp: Geppetto Pinocchio! Pinocchio! Please! Give me back my son!

cutscene.desc: Riku is on a high ledge, holding Pinocchio under his arm
cutscene.sp: Riku Sorry, old man. I have some unfinished business with this puppet.
Geppetto He’s no puppet! Pinocchio is my little boy!
Riku He is unusual. Not many puppets have hearts. I’m not sure, but maybe he can help someone who’s lost theirs.
Sora Wait a minute. Are you talking about Kairi?
Riku What do you care about her?

cutscene.desc: He walks toward Monstro’s throat. They go after him by climbing the piles of wood near the mouth. Sora finds another summon gem on top of one of them. They enter the throat and make their way to the stomach. Riku sets Pinocchio down on one of the platforms lining the walls as stomach acid pools on the floor
cutscene.sp: Sora Hey, let Pinocchio go, Riku.

cutscene.desc: He turns to see them. Pinocchio sits, unmoving
cutscene.sp: Riku A puppet that’s lost its heart to the Heartless... Maybe it holds the key to helping Kairi. How about it, Sora? Let’s join forces to save her. We can do it, together.

cutscene.desc: He starts walking toward Sora, who takes out the Keyblade
cutscene.sp: Riku (stopping) What? You’d rather fight me? Over a puppet that has no heart?
Sora Heart or no heart, at least he still has a conscience.
Riku Conscience?

cutscene.desc: Jiminy Cricket runs over to Pinocchio
cutscene.sp: Sora You might not hear it, but right now it’s loud and clear. And it’s telling me you’re on the wrong side!
Riku Then you leave me no choice.
Jiminy Pinocchio! Pinocchio!
Pinocchio (weakly) Jiminy... I’m not gonna make it.

cutscene.desc: Suddenly, his nose grows
cutscene.sp: Pinocchio Oh! I guess I’m okay!

cutscene.desc: Jiminy jumps happily. Sora looks over to Donald and Goofy. Riku thinks for a second before looking up suddenly as the Parasite Cage falls from a hole in the ceiling. Riku makes a quick exit through a corridor of darkness, leaving them alone with the Heartless. Pinocchio runs out of the stomach and the Parasite Cage picks itself up on its arms and swings itself at Sora and company. Donald yells and sends a Thunder spell at it, while Sora runs up to it and begins striking its body with the Keyblade. The Parasite Cage begins swinging its arms again, but Goofy slams his shield into them, causing the Heartless to reel back. The top head falls backwards, causing the cage to open. It lies there, unconscious, while Sora continues to deal damage to it. It straightens up and begins swinging its arms again, knocking out Donald. The Heartless places its arms into the stomach acid, sucking it up through its appendages, and blowing it out through its mouth. Sora falls in pain Goofy falls unconscious. While the Parasite Cage continues swinging its arms madly, Sora uses Cure on both Donald and Goofy and the three of them move in unison. With a few more strikes, it flies backwards, a glowing heart coming out of its cage- like mouth and floating away. It begins to fall over, splashing acid everywhere
cutscene.sp: Donald Run!
Sora Riku! Riku, where are you?

cutscene.desc: Riku has returned to his vessel, standing in the captain’s hold, talking to Maleficent
cutscene.sp: Riku So, Kairi’s like a lifeless puppet now?
Maleficent Precisely.

cutscene.desc: He stares at Kairi’s body, lying on the couch in front of him
cutscene.sp: Riku And her heart was...
Maleficent Taken by the Heartless, no doubt.

cutscene.desc: He whirls around, the desperation showing in his eyes
cutscene.sp: Riku Tell me! What can I do?

Maleficent There are seven maidens of the purest heart. We call them the princesses of heart. Gather them together, and a door will open to the heart of all worlds. Within lies untold wisdom. There, you will surely find a way to recover Kairi’s heart. Now, I’ll grant you a marvelous gift.

cutscene.desc: She leans closer to him
cutscene.sp: Maleficent The power to control the Heartless.

cutscene.desc: She raises her arms and green energy surrounds him. He takes it in, feeling its power, and turns to look at Kairi
cutscene.sp: Riku Soon, Kairi. Soon.

cutscene.desc: Monstro, disrupted by all this agitation, sneezes everyone out. Sora, Donald, and Goofy are back in their gummi ship
cutscene.sp: Goofy I sure hope Pinocchio and Geppetto are okay.
Donald Yeah, hopefully they landed safely somewhere.
Sora Riku...

cutscene.desc: They return to Merlin’s Study in Traverse Town and speak to the Fairy Godmother
cutscene.sp: Fairy Godmother Oh, another summon gem? Let’s help this little one. Here we go! Bibbidi-bobbidi-boo!

cutscene.desc: Sora is granted the power to summon Dumbo
cutscene.sp: Fairy Godmother If you find any more of these stones, bring them to me.

cutscene.desc: Sora enters the 100 Acre Wood, finding a broad expanse of vegetables fields. He walks across the bridge over the stream to a mailbox labeled RABBiT. There is a letter inside I hope we’ll be finding more honey together soon! --Pooh
Sora walks up to the door in the tree, but is stopped by a stern voice
cutscene.sp: ?????? Nobody’s home! And I’m out of honey!

cutscene.desc: Sora walks to the back of the tree, where Piglet and Pooh are staring in through a hole in a burrow beneath a sign reading RABBiT’S HOWSE. Piglet sees Sora
cutscene.sp: Piglet Look, Rabbt’s house c-came back! But it looks like Rabbit isn’t home. Pooh’s been calling and calling, but the house says no one’s there.
Pooh (calling) Nobody’s home?
?????? That’s right, Nobody!

cutscene.desc: Sora runs back around the house and enters through the door
cutscene.sp: Pooh Who is this person named Nobody?

cutscene.desc: Pooh begins climbing into the burrow
cutscene.sp: Pooh Nobody, have you seen Rabbit?
?????? No! No Rabbit here! There’s no one here!

cutscene.desc: Inside the burrow, a yellow rabbit sighs as Pooh hops in, Piglet following
cutscene.sp: Pooh Hello, Rabbit!
Rabbit Why, P-Pooh. What a pleasant surprise... Nice to see you, too, Piglet. And...

cutscene.desc: He turns around as Sora enters
cutscene.sp: Rabbit Is this a new friend? P-Pooh, I’m sorry, but... I’m all out of honey at the moment.

cutscene.desc: Pooh walks around the room, sniffing the air
cutscene.sp: Pooh Sora, do you smell honey?

cutscene.desc: Sora sees a honey pot on a tree root going through the ceiling
cutscene.sp: Rabbit H-Honey? Now, how did that get up there? Would you like some Pooh? Don’t feel you have to, of course.
Pooh Oh, thank you, Rabbit. I would like just a small smackeral. I’m quite hungry.

cutscene.desc: Pooh sits at the table eating from the honey pot
cutscene.sp: Rabbit Um, Pooh Bear...

cutscene.desc: Pooh eats
cutscene.sp: Rabbit You’re not eating the whole pot, are you?

cutscene.desc: And eats
cutscene.sp: Rabbit Once you start, there’s no stopping you, is there...

cutscene.desc: And eats
cutscene.sp: Rabbit (defeated) Ohh... Out of honey again.

cutscene.desc: Sora leaves the house and attempts to walk off the grounds
cutscene.sp: Piglet H-Help! Please help Pooh!

cutscene.desc: He turns around as Piglet runs up to him, and trips on the ground. Sora runs back inside with Piglet, seeing Pooh stuck in the hole in the wall
cutscene.sp: Pooh Oh, help and bother. I’m stuck again. I came in through this hole, so it must have shrunk.
Piglet Oh, wh-what to do?
Rabbit All this because he can’t stop liking honey so much!

cutscene.desc: Sora runs around to the back of the burrow, where Pooh’s head and arms are sticking out
cutscene.sp: Pooh Oh, how will I eat honey if I’m stuck here? When it’s lunch time, perhaps you could bring me a honey jar.
Rabbit No honey ‘til you’re unstuck!

cutscene.desc: Rabbit runs in
cutscene.sp: Rabbit If Pooh doesn’t slim down, my house will stay plugged up forever! If only there were something we could do...

cutscene.desc: He perks his head up, his ears pointed
cutscene.sp: Rabbit Wait, I know! A bit of carrot top juice will do the trick! I have a carrot patch on the other side of the stream. Carrot top juice is just the ticket to slimming down a Pooh!

cutscene.desc: He turns toward his garden and shouts
cutscene.sp: Rabbit Oh, no!

cutscene.desc: He runs ahead, Sora following. He sees a stuffed tiger bouncing into the area much to Rabbit’s dismay. The tiger jumps onto the bridge, destroying it, and bouncing over to Sora. Rabbit runs over to see the damage and lowers his ears. The tiger tackles Sora, knocking him over, laughing as his tail uncurls behind him
cutscene.sp: ?????? Hey, there! Name’s Tigger! T-I-double-guh-RR. That spells Tigger!

cutscene.desc: Tigger looks over Sora, standing on him
cutscene.sp: Tigger Well, now! I don’t think I’ve ever seen you before!
Pooh Hello, Tigger. You’ve just bounced my new friend Sora.
Tigger Hey, Pooh! Say, you’re lookin’ mighty uncomfy today. Is that some new exercise? Why, bouncin’ around is a lot more fun.

cutscene.desc: He leaps off of Sora, who stands up, brushing the dirt off his clothes
cutscene.sp: Sora Wh-Why do you bounce around so much, Tigger?
Tigger Why? ‘Cause bouncin’ is what Tiggers do best!

cutscene.desc: He puts a paw to his forehead and looks around
cutscene.sp: Tigger Speaking of which, my bouncin’ spot has gone and disappeared! So for now, this’ll be my new bouncin’ ground.

cutscene.desc: He laughs and bounces away towards Rabbit’s garden
cutscene.sp: Rabbit Tigger’s bouncing will ruin my vegetables! And if we don’t give Pooh some carrot top juice, he’ll be stuck forever.

cutscene.desc: Rabbit turns to Sora
cutscene.sp: Rabbit Please help me! Keep Tigger away from my carrots!
Owl This is quite a fix. But I have just the solution. Pay attention, now.

cutscene.desc: Owl flies down to meet them. He takes Sora over to the carrot field
cutscene.sp: Owl Sora, you’ll have to protect this carrot patch. If Tigger bounces on a carrot twice, it’ll be buried.

cutscene.desc: He demonstrates jumping on a carrot
cutscene.sp: Owl Once...

cutscene.desc: He jumps again
cutscene.sp: Owl Twice!

cutscene.desc: He flies back off the carrot
cutscene.sp: Owl Just like that. Protect the carrots from Tigger’s bounces and you’ll receive points. How you ask? It’s elementary!

cutscene.desc: He swings out a wing
cutscene.sp: Owl Simply get to the carrots before Tigger lands on them. There are fifteen carrots here. Your score depends on how many you save, and how many times you block Tigger. Oh, and one more thing.

cutscene.desc: He flies over to Sora
cutscene.sp: Owl The Rush command is the key to a high score. Select Rush while near a carrot that isn’t buried yet. You’ll dash to the target area before Tigger lands. Well, good luck!

cutscene.desc: Tigger bounces over and Sora protects the carrots from him. Tigger dances around
cutscene.sp: Tigger How about those bounceroonies? They were good even for a Tigger.

cutscene.desc: He laughs and bounces away
cutscene.sp: Rabbit Thank you so much. Now I’d better make that carrot top juice. I’ll get the carrots, so please wait inside the house.

cutscene.desc: Sora enters the house. Later, Rabbit returns
cutscene.sp: Rabbit Oh, what a day! I gave Pooh the carrot top juice. All we have to do now is push him out. Just a little push should do.

cutscene.desc: Sora runs and tackles Pooh out of the wall, sending him flying into a pile of honey pots. Piglet covers his eyes while Rabbit is in shock
cutscene.sp: Rabbit First my vegetable patch and now this...

cutscene.desc: Pooh sits up, a honey pot stuck over his head
cutscene.sp: Pooh Oh, bother. Where am I? It’s ever so dark in here. Well, it isn’t so bad, I suppose. There is plenty of honey.

cutscene.desc: He laughs and Sora regroups with Donald and Goofy in Merlin’s Study. They leave Traverse Town and compete in the Pegasus Cup at the Olympus Coliseum. After making their way through the tournament, they speak to Phil and Hercules
cutscene.sp: Hercules That was great! Looks like Phil’s trained another great hero!
Sora Is strength the most important part of a hero?
Philoctetes Well, what you really need is a strong heart. What makes a strong heart? If you have to ask, you’re not a hero yet!
Sora Stop talking in riddles!
Philoctetes It’s not a riddle!

cutscene.desc: They travel to Atlantica
cutscene.sp: Donald Okay, guys. Prepare for landing.
Sora Land where? In the sea? We’ll drown!
Donald Not with my magic, we won’t. Just leave it to me.

cutscene.desc: Under the water, fish scurry away as Sora, Donald, and Goofy appear in a flurry of bubbles. They inspect their new aquatic bodies. Sora has the tail of a dolphin, while Donald and Goofy are an octopus and a sea turtle, respectively. They swim around for a while, getting used to being underwater, before a mermaid and a small fish swim towards the alcove, followed by a red crab
cutscene.sp: ????? Come on, Sebastian!
Sebastian Ariel, wait! Slow down! Don’t leave me behind!

cutscene.desc: Sebastian comes face to face with a glaring Donald and screams. He swims away frantically while Sora paddles up to them
cutscene.sp: Ariel Relax, Sebastian. They don’t look like one of them. Right, Flounder?

cutscene.desc: She looks down to her fishy friend, who’s hiding behind her
cutscene.sp: Flounder I don’t know. There’s something weird about them.

cutscene.desc: Sora laughs nervously
cutscene.sp: Sora What do you mean?

cutscene.desc: She swims around him
cutscene.sp: Ariel They do seem... a little different. Where are you from?
Sora (nervous) We’re from kind of far away. And we’re not really used to these waters.

cutscene.desc: Goofy has a staring contest with Flounder. Sora continues to laugh nervously, not sure of what to say
cutscene.sp: Ariel Oh, I see. In that case... Sebastian can show you how we swim around here.
Sebastian Ariel, King Triton will not like this!

cutscene.desc: Ariel rolls her eyes and smiles
cutscene.sp: Ariel Oh, don’t worry.
Sebstian Easy for you to say... Okay, it’s time you learn how to swim properly. Practice swimming with Flounder. Try to tag him. All right. Begin.

cutscene.desc: Sora plays tag with Flounder until he gets the hang of swimming
cutscene.sp: Sebastian Good job. Now let’s move onto self-defense.
Ariel Sebastian!

cutscene.desc: He looks over to Ariel, who is pointing to the Heartless swimming towards them from the tunnel. Sebastian starts swimming furiously as Ariel swims into a side cave
cutscene.sp: Sebastian Class is over. Good luck!

cutscene.desc: Sebastian closes himself and Flounder in a clamshell. Sora, Donald, and Goofy fight off the Sea Neon Heartless. Ariel swims back when they’re gone, and Sora opens the clamshell
cutscene.sp: Ariel Those creatures chased us here.
Sebastian Oh, no! Those monsters might be heading for the palace, too!
Ariel We’d better head back right away!
Flounder But, wh-what if we run into more on our way back?

cutscene.desc: She looks over at the trio
cutscene.sp: Ariel I’m sorry, but we need your help. Please come to the palace with us. The trident markers on the walls point the way there. We won’t get lost as long as we follow them. Okay, let’s get going.

cutscene.desc: They swim to King Triton’s Palace, pursued by Heartless. As they enter the Throne Room, a bolt of lightning obliterates the Heartless
cutscene.sp: Triton That was too close. As long as I have my trident, I will not tolerate those creatures inside this palace.
Ariel Daddy!

cutscene.desc: She swims up to him, smiling
cutscene.sp: Triton Oh, Ariel! When will you listen? It’s dangerous out there!

cutscene.desc: She looks guilty
cutscene.sp: Triton Strange creatures lurk outside.

cutscene.desc: He gazes at Sora, Donald, and Goofy with stern eyes
cutscene.sp: Sebastian (clearing his throat) Behold. You swim before the ruler of the seas: His Majesty, King Triton.
Triton And who are they?
Ariel They helped us fight off those creatures.
Triton (warily) They don’t look familiar.
Sora We’re from an ocean very far away.
Goofy (swimming around) Yup. We came to find the Keyhole.
Triton (stunned) The what?
Ariel What’s that?
Goofy A-hyuck! Well, it’s a—
Triton (angrily) There’s no such thing! Certainly not here!
Ariel But, Daddy...
Triton Ariel, not another word! You are not to leave the palace. Is that clear?

cutscene.desc: She scowls at him and swims away. Sora, Donald and Goofy swim after her. Triton sighs
cutscene.sp: Triton Perhaps I’m being too strict... I’m just concerned for her safety.

cutscene.desc: He watches them swim away
cutscene.sp: Sebastian Of course, Your Majesty. But I must admit, now I’m quite curious about this Keyhole.
Triton That need not concern you, Sebastian. Have you anything to report?
Sebastian Just as you suspected, Your Majesty, they seem to be coming from Ursula’s grotto.
Triton I knew it. That sea witch is up to no good again.

cutscene.desc: He strokes his long white beard
cutscene.sp: Triton I see exile from the palace has taught her nothing.
Sebastian Yes, she poses serious danger.
Triton (sternly) And I told you to keep Ariel away from such danger, did I not?
Sebastian (nervously) Your Majesty, please, I, uh...

cutscene.desc: Ariel leads Sora, Donald, and Goofy to the Undersea Valley
cutscene.sp: Ariel Come to my grotto. I want to show you something.

cutscene.desc: She points to a large boulder on the sea floor
cutscene.sp: Ariel There it is. See?

cutscene.desc: They enter Ariel’s Grotto, which is filled with various thingamabobs from the human world
cutscene.sp: Ariel Look at all the wonderful things Flounder and I’ve collected. I think it’s all from the outside world.

cutscene.desc: At the end of the room, there is a trident-shaped impression in the rock
cutscene.sp: Ariel Someday, I’m going to see what’s out there. I want to see other worlds. Does that sound strange?
Sora No. Not at all. I used to feel the same way.
Ariel Used to?
Sora I mean...I still do.
Ariel Hey, why don’t we try looking for that Keyhole you were talking about?
Sora But your father said—
Ariel Oh, he treats me like a little girl. He never wants to let me do anything. He just... He just doesn’t understand.

cutscene.desc: Sebastian listens from behind a rock, with a sad look on his face. They speak to Flounder
cutscene.sp: Flounder There’s this really big fish who can swim against the current. But he’s scared of those weird things swimming around. So if we chase them away, I think the big fish’ll play with us. Maybe if you grab onto him, he’ll take you somewhere.

cutscene.desc: They swim out of the grotto, and two slippery eels come out of hiding. They each have a golden eye, glowing like their vicious grins. In her lair, the sea witch Ursula gazes into her cauldron at an image of Sora and Ariel, laughing to herself
cutscene.sp: Ursula Those impudent fools will never find the Keyhole.

cutscene.desc: The image of Ariel floats out of the cauldron with Ursula’s hand movements
cutscene.sp: Ursula But the girl could prove useful. And I’ve got the Heartless on my side.

cutscene.desc: Her long tentacles sway behind her
cutscene.sp: Ursula Triton, my old friend... Your day is coming.

cutscene.desc: She cackles loudly. Meanwhile, Sora, Donald, Goofy, and Ariel find a dolphin swimming in the Calm Depths. After eliminating the Heartless in the area, the dolphin lets them ride it through the rough current to a large area with a Sunken Ship. They enter the ship and an ominous shape swims in the waters above. Once they reach a stateroom inside the sunken ship a huge shark crashes through the window, attempting to bite them. It is unable to swim inside the shape due to its size, so it swims away and waits for them to leave. Inside the ship they find a crystal trident inside a treasure chest
cutscene.sp: Ariel Hm. Its shape reminds me of something...

cutscene.desc: They leave the ship, where Glut is waiting for them. After a persuasive battle, the shark gives up and swims away. They return to Ariel’s Grotto and place the crystal trident in the rocky impression
cutscene.sp: Triton Ariel, you’ve disobeyed me again!

cutscene.desc: They turn to see King Triton enter. Sebastian is on the floor
cutscene.sp: Triton I told you not to leave the palace!

cutscene.desc: He sees the crystal trident and is filled with anger. He raises his trident, which starts to glow. Ariel tries to stop him
cutscene.sp: Ariel Daddy, no!

cutscene.desc: A bolt of lightning fires from the trident and destroys the crystal
cutscene.sp: Ariel (sadly) How could you...

cutscene.desc: She swims away from him and he turns his eyes on Sora
cutscene.sp: Triton Young man, you’re not from another ocean. You’re from another world. Aren’t you?
Sora (surprised) Huh?
Triton Then you must be the key bearer.
Sora How did you know?
Triton You may fool Ariel, but you can’t fool me. You don’t know your dorsal fin from your tail.
Sora Aw...
Triton As the key bearer, you must already know... One must not meddle in the affairs of other worlds.
Sora Of course I know that, but...
Triton You have violated this principle. The key bearer shatters peace and brings ruin.
Goofy Aw, Sora’s not like that.
Triton I thank you for saving my daughter. But there is no room in my ocean for you or your key.

cutscene.desc: Triton leaves the grotto, leaving Sora staring down at the Keyblade. Ariel is alone in the Undersea Garden, crying to herself, when the two devious eels arrive
cutscene.sp: Flotsam My, my, the poor child suffers such deep sorrow.

cutscene.desc: They swim around her in circles
cutscene.sp: Jetsam What a pity. If only there were something we could do...
Flotsam Wait. Maybe she can be of some help.
Jetsam Yes. Maybe she can be of some help to you.
Ariel Who’re you talking about?

cutscene.desc: They start swimming upwards in a spiral
cutscene.sp: Flotsam Oh, she would surely help you.
Jetsam She’d make all your dreams come true.
Flotsam & Jetsam Ursula can help...

cutscene.desc: In a flourish of ink, Ursula appears
cutscene.sp: Ursula You called, my dear?

cutscene.desc: She smiles down at Ariel
cutscene.sp: Ariel (daunted) You’re Ursula? I was just wondering if—
Ursula It’s all right. Helping others is what I live for. Let me guess. You wish to see other worlds. That shouldn’t be too hard. After all, your new friends came from another world.
Ariel What?

cutscene.desc: The witch swims closer to her
cutscene.sp: Ursula But they had special help—that mysterious key.

cutscene.desc: Ariel looks toward the sea floor
cutscene.sp: Ursula Now, now. Cheer up, sweetie. You have something special, too.

cutscene.desc: The eels swim around them as Ursula leans in closely
cutscene.sp: Ursula Now listen carefully. I think the Keyhole they seek is somewhere in the palace.

cutscene.desc: Ariel swims into the palace throne room
cutscene.sp: Ursula Now, my dear, if you can take me there without your daddy knowing...

cutscene.desc: Ariel turns as Ursula enters behind her
cutscene.sp: Ursula I can help you get to these other worlds you long for.

cutscene.desc: She sees the trident floating behind the throne, and smiles. After Ursula snatches the trident, she laughs evilly
cutscene.sp: Ursula The trident is mine at last! And I couldn’t have done it without your help, my dear.

cutscene.desc: Ariel is at the throne beside her father, who looks terribly weak
cutscene.sp: Ariel Ursula, no! I didn’t want this!
Ursula Why not? Aren’t you tired of following your dear daddy’s orders?

cutscene.desc: The eels swim around them
cutscene.sp: Ursula Oh, yes. We had a deal, didn’t we? Time for a little journey—to the dark world of the Heartless!
Flotsam We cannot find the Keyhole.
Jetsam The Keyhole is not here.
Ursula What?

cutscene.desc: She looks behind her as Sora, Donald, and Goofy swim their way
cutscene.sp: Ursula Why, we have company. I’m afraid you’re a little late, handsome!

cutscene.desc: She chuckles, raising the trident and vanishing in a burst of ink just as they arrive. Ariel looks to King Triton
cutscene.sp: Ariel Daddy!
Triton (feebly) The trident... We must get it back.
Sora Come on, let’s go!

cutscene.desc: They start to swim out, but Ariel stops them
cutscene.sp: Ariel Wait, I’m going with you! My father is hurt and it’s all my fault. I have to stop Ursula!

cutscene.desc: Sora nods
cutscene.sp: Sebastian That’s right. I’m right behind you, Ariel.
Triton Ursula draws power from her cauldron. To defeat Ursula, you must strike her cauldron with magic.

cutscene.desc: They return to the Sunken Ship area and find a large stone with the marking of a sea monster. Behind a sunken lifeboat nearby, there is an something embedded in the wall. Sora is unable to reach it
cutscene.sp: Sora What is that thing?
Sebastian Need some help? I’ll show you how it’s done.

cutscene.desc: Sebastian swims between the lifeboat and the wall and pushes the small rock in the wall, causing the large leviathan rock to sink into the ocean floor. They enter the Den of Tides and follow it to Ursula’s Lair. Ursula crawls out of her shell be, scowling
cutscene.sp: Donald Come out! You can’t run!
Sebastian Your time has come!

cutscene.desc: She swims toward them giving them a frightening look, scaring Sebastian and Donald. She tosses a potion into her cauldron, which starts to glow. Goofy and Ariel start fighting off Flotsam and Jetsam while Sora and Donald strike her cauldron with magic
cutscene.sp: Ursula Sea and wind, hear my command!

cutscene.desc: Goofy and Ariel knock Flotsam and Jetsam unconscious and Sora sends a Thunder spell at Ursula’s cauldron, which ignites its contents, sending a burst of magic spilling out in all directions. Ursula is knocked out temporarily and Sora attacks with his Keyblade. Soon Ursula regains consciousness
cutscene.sp: Ursula Get up and fight!

cutscene.desc: She heals Flotsam and Jetsam and begins cackling, spinning wildly in the water. Donald casts an Aero spell on everyone to shield them from her whirling tentacles. Sora starts striking her cauldron until it explodes again onto Ursula
cutscene.sp: Ursula No... Impossible!

cutscene.desc: The foiled magic disintegrates Flotsam and Jetsam, to Ursula’s horror and she swims away in a fury
cutscene.sp: Ursula You’ll pay for this!
Ariel Let’s go. We must get the trident back.

cutscene.desc: She teaches them Mermaid Kick and they catch up to Ursula in the Open Ocean
cutscene.sp: Ursula You pathetic fools! I rule the seas now!

cutscene.desc: She brandishes the trident and spins upwards. A wave of ink and darkness emanates from below as she begins growing to an immense size. A crown appears on her head and she towers over them
cutscene.sp: Ursula The sea and all its spoils bow to my power!

cutscene.desc: They swim upward to escape from her crushing tentacles and she stares down at them with crazed eyes
cutscene.sp: Ursula Hey, you. Not so fast! Get ready for this!

cutscene.desc: She spits out disorienting bubbles at them, which stop them for a second, but they swim straight at her and begin pummeling away. Suddenly, the current changes and Sora feels himself being swept upward towards her mouth. He swims away frantically as Ariel and Donald attack from behind. He manages to get away just as she bites down
cutscene.sp: Ursula Hmph... Slippery little morsel.

cutscene.desc: Lightning strikes around them, a defense mechanism, as they attack her directly
cutscene.sp: Ursula You dare to strike me!

cutscene.desc: She summons an energy beam which she aims at Sora, who begins swimming around her to dodge it, but she continues circling, unwilling to let him escape. She catches her breath after the intense beam leaves her defenseless. Donald and Ariel continue attacking her head while Goofy goes for her hand, which is still clutching the trident. She gathers strength again and lifts the trident high
cutscene.sp: Ursula This won’t be pretty!

cutscene.desc: Several lightning bolts attack the water around them, almost knocking them all out. Ursula, at her wit’s end, begins inhaling water, dragging Sora toward her. Instead of swimming away, he uses this to propel himself toward her and tackles her with the Keyblade right into her throat. She tries to scream, holding her hands to her throat as the water around her crackles with energy. She begins flailing and disappears in a flurry of darkness, leaving only the trident floating in a beam of light. They return to the Throne Room and speak to King Triton
cutscene.sp: Ariel Daddy, I’m so sorry.
Sora Please don’t be angry with her.
Triton It’s my fault. You followed Ursula because... I wouldn’t let you follow your heart. And when you found that crystal, I lost my temper and destroyed it.
Goofy Oh, yeah, the crystal! Why did you destroy it?
Triton The crystal held the power to reveal the Keyhole. The Keyhole is dangerous. I had to keep you away from it at any cost.
Ariel Daddy...
Triton Key bearer, I have one more request: Seal the Keyhole. My trident also holds the power to reveal the Keyhole. Will you do it?
Sora Of course. That’s what we had in mind from the start.
Ariel Where is the Keyhole, Daddy?
Triton You should know better than anyone. It’s in your grotto.
Goofy Really... Sora, let’s go.

cutscene.desc: They return to Ariel’s Grotto and Ariel uses the trident to reveal the Keyhole. Sora aims his Keyblade at it and seals it. Ariel floats over to him
cutscene.sp: Ariel Tell me, Sora. Your world, what’s it like?
Sora Oh, about that... Sorry for lying to you.
Ariel (smiling) It’s okay. Besides, if you can travel to other worlds, maybe I can, too.

cutscene.desc: She swims upwards in a spiral, looking towards the surface
cutscene.sp: Ariel So many places I want to see... I know I’ll get there someday. I’ll find a way somehow. I’m sure of it.
Sebastian (sighing) Well, if you find it, do me a favor and leave me out of it.
Ariel This is from my collection. I want you to have it.

cutscene.desc: She gives Sora a keychain and they return to the gummi ship
cutscene.sp: Sora I think my magic is as good as Donald’s now.
Donald No way! Not in a million years.
Goofy Why don’t you go see Merlin? Work more on your magic.

cutscene.desc: They travel to Merlin’s Study and speak to him after training with him a bit
cutscene.sp: Merlin You’re making excellent progress. Here’s something for your effort.

cutscene.desc: He gives them a keychain
cutscene.sp: Merlin Keep it up.

cutscene.desc: Sora decides to return to the 100 Acre Wood with another torn page. He enters, finding a swing hanging from a stout tree near a river. He sees Pooh and Piglet on the bridge overlooking the river
cutscene.sp: Piglet Look, Pooh. Something is floating this way.
Pooh I think you’re right, Piglet. What could it be?

cutscene.desc: A gray donkey floats slowly along the current of the river, a glum expression on its face
cutscene.sp: Pooh (waving) Why, it looks like Eeyore! Hello, Eeyore, if it is you.

cutscene.desc: He floats toward the bridge
cutscene.sp: Eeyore Hello, Pooh. Yes, it’s me. Could you pull me out? That is, if it’s not too much trouble. Of course, you don’t have to if you don’t want to.

cutscene.desc: He drifts under the bridge and Sora jumps in to get him. They meet on the riverbank with Pooh and Piglet
cutscene.sp: Eeyore Thank you, Pooh. Thank you, other you. You know, floating along out there, it seemed like something was missing...

cutscene.desc: Piglet runs behind Eeyore
cutscene.sp: Eeyore And something’s still missing.
Piglet Why, Eeyore’s tail is gone! Is that what’s missing?

cutscene.desc: Eeyore looks behind him
cutscene.sp: Eeyore Let’s see... Yep, lost it again. Wonder where it went this time. It’s not much of a tail, though I’m sort of attached to it. But I don’t know why anybody’d look for it. Probably won’t find it anyway...
Pooh Sora, why don’t we all look for Eeyore’s tail?
Owl Lost something?

cutscene.desc: Owl flies in from above
cutscene.sp: Owl Searching from a high place is the quickest way to find it!
Sora Owl, can you fly up high and help us find Eeyore’s tail?

Owl Sorry, but my eyes aren’t what they used to be. Too much reading, you know. But I can offer good advice! Of course, you don’t have to if you don’t want to. See that swing up there? Take Pooh there.

cutscene.desc: He motions toward the tree at the top of a hill
cutscene.sp: Owl You’re a bit too big for the swing, but Pooh should fit nicely. I’ll tell you more when you get there.

cutscene.desc: He flies away. Sora leads Pooh up the hill to the swing, where Owl is perched on the branch above them. Pooh gets on the swing
cutscene.sp: Owl Here’s what to do. First, get ready to push.
Sora How?
Owl Like this.

cutscene.desc: Owl demonstrates
cutscene.sp: Sora Like this?

cutscene.desc: Sora pushes the swing gently
cutscene.sp: Sora How’s this?
Owl Not bad, not bad! Here’s the next step. If you time it right, Pooh will swing higher and higher. Try it! Push too soon, Pooh won’t go any higher. Push too late, he’ll go too high.

cutscene.desc: With Owl’s help, Sora pushes Pooh on the swing, tossing him into the air so he can search for Eeyore’s tail from high above. He lands right in front of Rabbit on a house made of sticks, knocking Eeyore over. Pooh stands up and Eeyore sees something under the pile of sticks
cutscene.sp: Eeyore Hm? That looks familiar...

cutscene.desc: Sora repins Eeyore’s tail onto him
cutscene.sp: Pooh How’s it looking?
Sora There we go.

cutscene.desc: Eeyore swings his tail around
cutscene.sp: Eeyore It’s not much of a tail, but it’s mine. Thanks, everyone.
Pooh I wish we could put the Hundred Acre Wood back the way it was, too!

cutscene.desc: Owl sits on the branch of the tree, waving a wing. Pooh’s words make Sora more determined to find the rest of the book’s torn pages. Sora leaves the hill and finds Pooh at his house, sitting on a log outside
cutscene.sp: Pooh (shivering) Brrr! I think I spend too much time on the swing.

cutscene.desc: Sora targets the pile of sticks in front of them and ignites them into a small fire. Pooh extends his hands to warm them
cutscene.sp: Pooh Thank you, Sora. This is nice and warm. You’ve helped us so much. This is just something to say thank you.

cutscene.desc: Pooh hops off the log and gives Sora a Mythril stone. Sora leaves the 100 Acre Wood and the three travel to a dark world filled with pumpkins and ghosts. Donald changes their outfits so they blend in with the eerie scenery
cutscene.sp: Goofy This sure is a spooky place. I’ll bet the people here are scary- lookin’ too.
Donald Don’t worry. We look spooky, too. If they scare us, we’ll scare them right back!
Goofy You think so?

cutscene.desc: They enter the Town Square and an explosion goes off in a nearby laboratory, sending smoke into the air. They see a group of Search Ghost Heartless in town, but they don’t attack. Sora makes his way over to the laboratory when they hear a booming voice
cutscene.sp: ????? And now, allow me to introduce...

cutscene.desc: They look over to see a short man in an extremely tall hat speaking through a megaphone. He wears a spider as a bow tie and a ribbon reading Mayor is attached to his business suit. From their angle, it looked like he had a second face behind his head
cutscene.sp: Mayor The master of terror... the king of nightmares—Jack Skellington!

cutscene.desc: The line of Search Ghosts part as they present the fountain in the middle of the square, where a tall, thin figure was emerging from the green water. He had a black and white striped outfit and long bony fingers. His head was naught but a skull; behind his eyes, only blackness. He strikes a pose and smiles, and the Mayor runs over to him
cutscene.sp: Mayor Bravo, Jack! Bravo! Those ghosts will be a big hit at this year’s Halloween!

cutscene.desc: The Mayor grins wildly as Jack steps out from the fountain
cutscene.sp: Jack Thank you, thank you! But their movement still needs work. It’s not scary enough.

cutscene.desc: He hangs his head
cutscene.sp: Jack I want to strike bone-chilling terror.

cutscene.desc: He lifts his arms in a creepy pose, and the Mayor backs up
cutscene.sp: Jack I’m going to consult the doctor.

cutscene.desc: He stands and walks to the laboratory
cutscene.sp: Mayor Then I’ll go attend to the decorations.

cutscene.desc: He runs away gleefully. So gleefully, in fact, that he runs in the wrong direction and has to turn around. Sora, Donald, and Goofy follow Jack to Doctor Finkelstein’s research lab, where the doctor is inspecting the Heartless on the examination table from the comfort of his wheelchair. The various machines on the walls gurgle and hiss
cutscene.sp: Jack I don’t understand. Maybe the guidance system was damaged in the explosion.
Finkelstein Nonsense. My devices are always perfect!

cutscene.desc: Jack searches through the doctor’s research book
cutscene.sp: Jack Oh, I’ve got it! Why, of course! The Heartless need a heart! Doctor, do you think we can add a heart to that device?
Finkelstein Certainly. A heart’s not all that complicated.

cutscene.desc: He rides his motorized wheelchair to the end of the table
cutscene.sp: Finkelstein Let’s get to work.
Jack (reading) To make a heart, first take a container with a lock...

cutscene.desc: The doctor pulls out a pulsing box shaped like a human heart with a large keyhole on it
cutscene.sp: Finkelstein We need the key to this thing first!
Donald You’re really gonna unlock it for them?
Sora Why not? If they succeed, we won’t have to fight the Heartless, right? Besides, I want to see the Heartless dance, too. Don’t you?
Donald Not really.

cutscene.desc: Sora unlocks the heart for them
cutscene.sp: Jack My! That was amazing! Uh, and you are...

cutscene.desc: He cocks his head to the side
cutscene.sp: Sora Sora.

cutscene.desc: Jack walks up to him
cutscene.sp: Jack Well done, Sora! I’d like you to be a part of this year’s Halloween.
Sora (pointing) What’s this Heartless doing here?

Jack Oh, the Heartless came to town just recently. What’s frustrating is I can’t get them to dance with me. So the doctor and I are trying to improve the guidance system. He’s quite a genius! Okay, Doctor, let’s continue. The ingredients for a heart: Pulse.

cutscene.desc: A pulsing frog is placed on the table
cutscene.sp: Jack Emotion.
Finkelstein Terror.

cutscene.desc: Then a large spider
cutscene.sp: Jack Fear.

cutscene.desc: The doctor’s hand slides off a pane of glass on the table, making an eerie screech
cutscene.sp: Jack Hope and despair.

cutscene.desc: Two snakes, with their mouths over each other’s tails, are placed on the table and they glance at one another
cutscene.sp: Jack Mix them all together, and we have a heart!

cutscene.desc: The doctor completes this and places the heart into the console of the machine. He wheels over to a large lever and initiates the experiment. The machine sparks to life, gears clicking and whirling. Electricity crackles over the Heartless, who suddenly sits up with its arms outstretched, before falling limp
cutscene.sp: Finkelstein It failed!

cutscene.desc: Jack looks disappointed and the doctor peers over his research book
cutscene.sp: Finkelstein Maybe we’re missing some ingredients. Let’s try adding memory.

cutscene.desc: The doctor opens his skullcap and literally scratches his brain
cutscene.sp: Finkelstein (calling) Sally! Sally! Good-for-nothing girl! Don’t know why I bothered creating her!

cutscene.desc: He slams his fists on the arms of his wheelchair and closes his skull. He whirls around to face them
cutscene.sp: Finkelstein Sally’s got the memory we need. See if you can track her down.
Jack (patting his chest) No problem. Sora, would you like to come along?
Sora Sure.

cutscene.desc: They leave the laboratory and see the Mayor at the bottom of the stairs, his unhappy face on
cutscene.sp: Mayor (yelling into his megaphone) Jack! Jack! We have a major crisis! The Heartless are completely out of control! We can’t stop them!
Jack Hmm... Maybe our experiment triggered something. Everything will be fine, Mayor. You have nothing to worry about.

cutscene.desc: Donald taps his foot, looking in Jack’s direction. They enter Guillotine Plaza and fight a group of Heartless before entering the Graveyard
cutscene.sp: Sora Let’s check this place, too, once the Heartless here are out of our way.

cutscene.desc: They defeat the Heartless in the Graveyard and a ghostly dog with a glowing pumpkin for a nose, rises out of his doghouse grave. Jack walks up to him
cutscene.sp: Jack Zero! Have you seen Sally anywhere?

cutscene.desc: Zero flies over to a gravestone, startling the person behind it. A rag doll with long hair stands up and looks over at them, the stitches covering her body clearly visible
cutscene.sp: Sally Is something wrong, Jack?
Jack (excitedly) No, everything’s going great. We’re going to have the best Halloween ever. All we need now is your memory.
Sally Memory? You mean this?

cutscene.desc: She pulls out a gnarled flower. She gives the Forget-Me-Not to Jack, who stares at it curiously
cutscene.sp: Sally Jack, I have a bad feeling about this. Why don’t you try something else? There’s still time.
Jack Nothing could beat what I’ve got planned!

cutscene.desc: He spins around to face her
cutscene.sp: Jack Once we give the Heartless a heart, they’ll dance just as I envision it.

cutscene.desc: Sally looks worried
cutscene.sp: Jack Trust me. You’re going to love it!

cutscene.desc: Sora talks to Sally
cutscene.sp: Sally I have a bad feeling about this. If only Jack would reconsider... I’m happy if he’s happy, but I’m just so worried about him. I’m worried about him because I...well, I just am. Jack, why not have these kids star in the festival instead? They both look rather frightful. And funny, too. They’d be better than the Heartless.

cutscene.desc: Sora, Donald, Goofy, and Jack leave the Graveyard, with Sally following. From a coffin near the end of the graveyard, laughter erupts before the lid flies open. Three little imps jump out dressed like a devil, witch, and skeleton, respectively. They wear masks on their faces because they like it
cutscene.sp: Lock Lock!
Shock Shock!
Barrel Barrel!

cutscene.desc: They huddle together
cutscene.sp: Barrel Did you hear that?
Lock Yeah, I sure did! A heart! What should we do?
Shock Gosh, you really are stupid! Isn’t it obvious?
Barrel Tell Oogie Boogie.

cutscene.desc: They laugh. Sora and company return to Dr. Finkelstein’s Lab and give him the memory
cutscene.sp: Finkelstein Yes. This is it. Now, just one more ingredient. We need surprise to complete the heart. The mayor should know where it is.

cutscene.desc: Meanwhile, Lock, Shock, and Barrel are trembling in the presence of a laughing monster named Oogie Boogie. He has the appearance of a burlap sack tied together with thread. Two holes for the eyes curve evilly, giving him a nightmarish look. His hands and feet end in points, rather than fingers, and an opening in the cloth is stitched together for the mouth
cutscene.sp: Oogie Boogie A heart? That bonehead Jack is really making a heart? I’ll be jiggered! That works for me!

cutscene.desc: He smiles
cutscene.sp: Oogie Boogie Ohh, when I get my hands on that...

cutscene.desc: He looks at his pointed extremities
cutscene.sp: Oogie Boogie Well, I’ve got no hands, but I’m still gonna nab that heart and control the Heartless.

cutscene.desc: He cackles powerfully. Sora, Donald, Goofy and Jack find the Mayor in the Boneyard near a giant pumpkin and talk to him
cutscene.sp: Mayor Ghost rise from those tombstones. Check the tombstones in the order the ghosts appear. If you get it wrong, you’re in for a surprise!

cutscene.desc: He points to a nearby group of gravestones, where they see three ghosts rising from various ones and vanishing. They pick the correct ones and there is an explosion behind them
cutscene.sp: Mayor Splendid! Now go look at the pumpkin.

cutscene.desc: They turn around to see the pumpkin destroyed with a treasure chest inside. They open it and take out a Jack-in-the-Box. They return to Dr. Finkelstein’s Lab and give him the Jack-in-the-Box
cutscene.sp: Finkelstein Yes. This is it.

cutscene.desc: The doctor assembles the ingredients into the heart
cutscene.sp: Finkelstein There you go. This time it’s sure to work.

cutscene.desc: He wheels over with the heart on his lap, when Barrel jumps out from under his research table, tripping him over
cutscene.sp: Barrel Ya!

cutscene.desc: Finkelstein yells as he falls out of his chair, causing the heart to bounce over the table and into Lock’s arms. The doctor growls, shaking a gloved fist at them. Lock snickers and the three escape
cutscene.sp: Finkelstein The nerve of those little hooligans, stealing my work!

cutscene.desc: Sora, Donald, Goofy, and Jack race after the trio to Guillotine Square
cutscene.sp: Sora We lost them!

cutscene.desc: Jack taps a hand on his leg, calling Zero over to him
cutscene.sp: Jack Zero, after them, quick!

cutscene.desc: Zero flies towards the Graveyard to Moonlight Hill, where a large curled hill unfurls, making a pathway to a bridge. Lock, Shock, and Barrel ride in a walking bathtub over the hill. Sora and company arrive and defeat the Heartless in the area. They find a hidden switch in a gravestone, which unfurls the hill for them and they walks across to the bridge to Oogie’s Manor, where the bathtub is approaching a wooden bridge. Sora, Donald, Goofy, and Jack run in
cutscene.sp: Jack I knew Oogie Boogie was behind this!

cutscene.desc: They stare up towards the twisted mansion. They make their way up the mansion, fighting Heartless until they find the topmost room. They enter the Evil Playroom to find Lock, Shock, and Barrel tossing the heart down a shaft. They whirl around when they enter. Sora and company subdue the three imps and force them to talk
cutscene.sp: Shock We were just following orders! Oogie Boogie told us to steal the heart. It’s all Barrels fault! It was his idea to tell Oogie Boogie about the heart.
Lock Yeah, that’s right!
Barrel B-But you guys said—
Shock You should be ashamed!
Lock Oogie Boogie made us do it. We had no choice.
Barrel Oogie Boogie told us not to give away his hiding place. Oh, and we’re not supposed to talk about the lever, either.

cutscene.desc: Sora activates a lever on a control panel and gears in the wall begin to spin
cutscene.sp: Barrel What’s he going to do with the heart? Beats me. I’d stay away from Oogie Boogie if I were you.
Shock Hey, I was just following Oogie Boogie’s orders! We don’t have the heart! Oogie Boogie has it!
Lock There’s no way I’m gonna take you to him! If I did that, Oogie Boogie would eat us too.
Shock You’ll never find the green door!

cutscene.desc: They make their way down to Oogie’s Torture Chamber, which looks like a giant roulette wheel. They run in and find Oogie Boogie with the heart
cutscene.sp: Jack Oogie Boogie, give me back the heart!
Oogie Boogie You want it? Well, then come on over and get it!

cutscene.desc: He puts the heart in his mouth and swallows it to everyone’s surprise. He beings cackling
cutscene.sp: Oogie Boogie Now, let’s see if I can get their attention. (calling) Oh, Heartless!

cutscene.desc: Two Gargoyle Heartless appear behind him
cutscene.sp: Oogie Boogie This is it?

cutscene.desc: He starts to get angry
cutscene.sp: Oogie Boogie (yelling) Nobody disrespects me! Nobody!

cutscene.desc: He pulls a switch causing an explosion from behind Sora and company, knocking them into the pit of the roulette wheel. The Heartless fly down and attack them, but they are quickly defeated
cutscene.sp: Oogie Boogie C’mon, baby!

cutscene.desc: Oogie, being a gambling man, throws exploding dice into the pit, but they dodge out of the way. Sora activates a switch that raises his section of the pit, allowing him access to the boogeyman. Sora holds a hand to his chest and raises his Keyblade, which lights up and a bubble drops down from above. The bubble pops, revealing a young elephant with enormous ears. Sora jumps onto Dumbo, grabbing onto the elephant’s hat. Dumbo flies into the air with his huge ears and sprays a torrent of water at Oogie Boogie. Once the boogeyman has had enough of this, he activates an explosion. Dumbo disappears and Sora is sent back into the pit. Donald attempts to strike Oogie from below with Thunder and Gravity spells
cutscene.sp: Oogie Boogie Buzzsaw!

cutscene.desc: A spinning saw blade whirls past Sora, nearly slicing him in half. The roulette wheel begins spinning around, sending Sora, Donald, and Goofy in front of three slot machines
cutscene.sp: Oogie Boogie Bone Soldiers!

cutscene.desc: The eys of the slot machines glow and they raise their pistols, shooting at the three of them. They jump out of the way onto another button that sends all four of them upward to face Oogie. They attack Oogie Boogie with everything they have, causing the villain’s burlap sack to open and a swarm of squirming bugs to fall all over the floor. Oogie Boogie screams before the sack falls motionless with the heart still inside as a final blue bug crawls out of it. It lands on its back, squirming on the floor of the pit
cutscene.sp: Jack So, that heart was a failure after all.

cutscene.desc: They leave Oogie’s Manor, crossing the wooden bridge back to the ridge they entered from, when a large explosion occurs behind them, sending everyone off balance
cutscene.sp: Jack Huh?

cutscene.desc: Dust billows out from the mansion and they hear Oogie Boogie moaning. When the dust settles, they see his body overtaking the house, covered in orb of darkness
cutscene.sp: Sora Whoa! How did he get so big?
Jack Look! It’s brimming with the power of darkness! Oogie Boogie is drawing power from those dark globs!
Sora So we just have to destroy those things, right?

cutscene.desc: The four jump down as the bridge is now destroyed and make their way up the living mansion, destroying the dark orbs in their path. After the final one is taken out, the mansion quakes and crumbles to the ground. In its place a giant Keyhole appears. Sora sends a beam of light into the air, which breaks up and falls on the Keyhole, locking it. They return to Dr. Finkelstein’s Lab, where Sally is waiting for them
cutscene.sp: Jack Sally, why didn’t I listen to you?
Sally Don’t feel bad, Jack. We’ll come up with another plan for Halloween. Next time, we’ll do it together.

cutscene.desc: They hold hands and stare into each other’s eyes. Sora, Donald, and Goofy speak to Jack
cutscene.sp: Jack I guess we have no choice. We’ll have to cancel the Heartless Halloween festival for now. Here, I want you to have this.

cutscene.desc: He gives Sora a keychain
cutscene.sp: Jack Visit us any time, Sora. Next year’s Halloween will be the scariest ever!

cutscene.desc: The doctor is rereading his research book, thinking out loud
cutscene.sp: Finkelstein Emotion, memory... We put in all the necessary ingredients. What else do you need to make a heart? What is a heart, anyway? I can’t figure it out.

cutscene.desc: They return to the gummi ship and fly through space
cutscene.sp: Goofy Uh, a big ship is catching up to us.

cutscene.desc: The ship flies past them, its sails clearly visible
cutscene.sp: Donald Quit gawking! That’s a pirate ship!

cutscene.desc: The Jolly Roger turns and heads straight for them
cutscene.sp: Sora It’s going to ram us! Hold tight!

cutscene.desc: The gummi ship is taken aboard the Jolly Roger. Sora walks along the deck and turns around
cutscene.sp: Riku I didn’t think you’d come, Sora.

cutscene.desc: Sora gasps, looking up at Riku on the main deck
cutscene.sp: Riku Good to see you again.
Sora Where are Donald and Goofy?
Riku Are they that important to you? More important than old friends? Instead of worrying about them, you should be asking...

cutscene.desc: He moves over
cutscene.sp: Riku ...about her.

cutscene.desc: Sora sees Kairi, sitting on the floor beside Riku. She is breathing, but making no reactions to anything around her
cutscene.sp: Sora Kairi!
Riku That’s right. While you were off goofing around, I finally found her. (Sora starts to run towards them, when a hook blocks his path)
???? Not so fast. No shenanigans aboard my vessel, boy.

cutscene.desc: Sora looks up to see the pirate captain smirking as he is surrounded by Pirate Heartless
cutscene.sp: Sora Riku, why are you siding with the Heartless?
Riku The Heartless obey me now, Sora. Now I have nothing to fear.

cutscene.desc: Sora glares at him and his careless eyes
cutscene.sp: Sora You’re stupid. Sooner or later they’ll swallow your heart.
Riku Not a chance. My heart’s too strong.
Sora Riku...
Riku I’ve picked up a few other tricks as well. Like this, for instance.

cutscene.desc: He raises a hand and Sora’s shadow lifts out of the ground. Sora stares at it in astonishment
cutscene.sp: Riku You can go see your friends now.

cutscene.desc: A trapdoor opens underneath him and he falls through
cutscene.sp: Riku (to the captain) Let’s get under way, already. And keep Sora away from Kairi until we’re ready to land.

cutscene.desc: Riku walks towards the Captain’s Hold
cutscene.sp: ???? (to his First Mate) That scurvy brat thinks he can order me around!
???? What shall we do, Captain Hook?
Hook (frustrated) Nothing! The hold is crawling with Heartless.

cutscene.desc: He makes flourished movements as he speaks
cutscene.sp: Captain Hook Let them keep an eye on the brats.
???? But, Captain, you-know-who is also down—
Captain Hook Shh... Did you hear that, Smee? Oh, that dreadful sound!

cutscene.desc: He looks around
cutscene.sp: Smee No, Captain.
Hook (shaking Smee) Are you quite sure? Did I imagine it? Oh, my poor nerves...

cutscene.desc: Down in the Hold, Sora tells Donald and Goofy about Kairi
cutscene.sp: Goofy You don’t say?
Sora Yeah, it was definitely Kairi. I’ve finally found her.
Goofy All right! A-hyuck! Then let’s go up and talk to her.
Sora Yeah!
Donald Sounds great. Okay, but first...how about getting off!

cutscene.desc: Sora and Goofy had fallen on top of Donald
cutscene.sp: Sora Oh, sorry.

cutscene.desc: They get up off the floor and Sora peers through a window in the door
cutscene.sp: ????? Ahem!

cutscene.desc: Sora jumps down from the window and they stare at the barrels in the corner of the room
cutscene.sp: ????? How ya doin’ there? Looking for a way out?

cutscene.desc: Out jumps a young boy in green tights, carring a dagger in a scabbard at his waist. He wears a green cap over his fiery hair that has a red feather in it
cutscene.sp: Goofy Who are you?
????? (smiling) I’m the answer to your prayers.

cutscene.desc: Donald taps his foot, giving off a squawk in disbelief
cutscene.sp: ????? Okay, then. Fine. Have it your way.
Sora But you’re stuck in here too, aren’t you?
????? (crossing his arms) No. I’m just waiting for someone.
Sora Who?

cutscene.desc: A bright light flies into the room and swirls around Sora, giving off magical dust. It flies up to the boy
cutscene.sp: ????? Tinker Bell, what took you so long?

cutscene.desc: The bright light fades and reveals a tiny pixie in a small leaf-like dress. Her wings flutter softly behind her blond updo as she speaks to him through light and sound
cutscene.sp: ????? Great job. So you found Wendy?

cutscene.desc: She continues making sounds that Sora cannot understand
cutscene.sp: ????? Hold on. There was another girl there, too?

cutscene.desc: Tinker Bell crosses her arms
cutscene.sp: ????? Are you crazy? There’s no way I’m gonna leave Wendy there!
Donald Aha. She must be pretty jealous.

cutscene.desc: Donald laughs and Tinker Bell turns around, stamping her foot in the air and glaring at him. She flies over to him and kicks him on the beak, making him dizzy. She flies out of the room in a huff
cutscene.sp: ????? Come on, Tink! Open up the door!
Sora Ahem!

cutscene.desc: Sora smirks, much to the boy’s chagrin
cutscene.sp: ????? I’m Peter Pan.

cutscene.desc: He holds out his hand
cutscene.sp: Sora I’m Sora.

cutscene.desc: He moves his hand to shake, Peter’s but the boy pulls back
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan Okay, we’re in this together, but only ‘til we find Wendy.

cutscene.desc: He puts his hands on his hips petulantly. They leave the room thanks to Sora’s Keyblade and are attacked by a swarm of Heartess. Sora’s Shadow appears in front of them, taunting them while floating in the air. Sora strikes it and they defeat the Heartless, making their way through the ship undetected. They walk through another hold as Peter Pan flies above them
cutscene.sp: Goofy So, uh, how come you can fly?
Peter Pan Anyone can fly. You wanna try?

cutscene.desc: He whistles and Tinker Bell flies into the room
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan Aw, haven’t you cooled off yet, Tink?

cutscene.desc: He takes her by the wings and holds her over Sora, Donald, and Goofy, sprinkling magical dust on them
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan Just a little bit of pixie dust. There. Now you can fly.

cutscene.desc: Donald jumps into the air, swinging his arms up and down, but he falls to the floor. Tinker Bell flies down and laughs at him, as he taps his finger on the floor. Meanwhile, Riku is in the Captain’s Hold talking to Captain Hook
cutscene.sp: Captain Hook What? So Wendy’s not one of the chosen ones?
Riku There are seven, supposedly, and Maleficent says she’s not one of them.

cutscene.desc: He faces the door
cutscene.sp: Riku Hoist anchor as soon as possible. Leave all the dead weight behind, including her.
Captain Hook After the trouble of capturing her? And why those seven? What is Maleficent planning, anyway?
Riku Who knows? As long as it means getting Kairi’s heart back, I couldn’t care less.
Captain Hook You’re wasting your time! The Heartless has devoured that girl’s heart. I’ll stake me other hand it’s lost forever.
Riku I will find it no matter what.
Smee Uh, Captain...

cutscene.desc: Captain Hook walks over to a speaking tube, where Smee’s voice was coming from
cutscene.sp: Captain Hook What?
Smee The prisoners have escaped. What’s more, Peter Pan is with them.
Hook (annoyed) Blast that Peter Pan! All right, then! Bring the hostage to me cabin, Smee! Hop to it!

cutscene.desc: In the Galley, Tinker Bell is flying up near the ceiling, getting Peter Pan’s attention
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan What is it, Tink?

cutscene.desc: A young girl in a blue dress is sitting on her cot in the room above. There is a grate in the floor with which to see and hear through. She turns her head towards the sound
cutscene.sp: ????? Peter? Peter Pan?

cutscene.desc: She stands up cordially and rushes to the grate in the floor, kneeling
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan Wendy!
Wendy Please hurry! The pirates are coming!
Peter Pan What! I’ll be right up there! Just hold on!
Sora Wendy?

cutscene.desc: She looks over at him
cutscene.sp: Wendy Yes?
Sora Is there another girl in there with you?

cutscene.desc: She looks up at Kairi, who’s still sitting limp on the floor
cutscene.sp: Wendy Oh, why, yes. But she seems to be asleep. She hasn’t budged an inch.
Sora Kairi? Kairi!

cutscene.desc: Sora can see part of Kairi’s leg through the grate. Her arm falls next to her with the movement of the ship. He holds out a hand with a sad, but hopeful face. Wendy stands up and grabs hold of a dresser. Kairi’s fingers twitch, putting a smile on Sora’s face. The door opens and Kairi is dragged away. Wendy cries out as she is taken away and the door shuts
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan Wendy! Hey, let’s get up there!

cutscene.desc: They reach a higher level of the ship in the hall where Wendy’s cabin is. Peter Pan bangs on the locked door
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan (calling) Wendy, are you in there?

cutscene.desc: They enter another door into a room with a ladder. They climb up to the Captain’s Hold. Sora runs ahead and sees Riku
cutscene.sp: Sora Riku, wait!

cutscene.desc: Riku holds Kairi in his arms as a shadow flows in from under the door behind him. Riku backs away towards the door and the shadow leaps out of the floor. It looks just like Sora, staring eerily with glowing eyes. Riku escapes and the shadow crawls along the floor underfoot. Jumping up at Sora, striking him with a dark duplicate of the Keyblade. It moves like Sora, attacking and deflecting blows just the same. Sora goes after it, but it sinks back into the floor, splitting into three copies. The room crowded, Peter Pan flies forward striking them with his shadow and giving a loud crow. He destroys two of the shadows, leaving the real one at the mercy of his blade. Antisora vanishes into a burst of darkness and turns invisible. Catching Sora offguard, he swipes at him in the air, visible for only a second, before disappearing. Antisora makes no sound due to its status as a shadow, so they don’t have the help of following its footfalls. Donald attempts to bring it out with Thunder spells, but it wears him out and comes up empty. It strikes at Peter Pan, but Goofy’s shield blocks it. Sora uses Strike Raid, tossing his Keyblade through the room. It flies through the air, spinning wildly until it makes contact with Antisora, who freezes on the spot, it’s darkness dripping to the floor. It stands there motionless like a statue before falling into the dark pool. Sora’s shadow returns to him and they drop down through the floor into Wendy’s room. They find her laying on the floor with her eyes closed. Peter Pan floats down next to her and picks her head up
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan Wendy!

cutscene.desc: Tinker Bell flies around in the air above him
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan Come on, Tink! Not now!

cutscene.desc: He waves her off and she flies away
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan Well, this is as far as I can go. I’ve gotta help Wendy.

cutscene.desc: He picks her up and flies out of the room, leaving Sora, Donald, and Goofy by themselves. They return to the Captain’s Hold and takes the doorway to the Main Deck, where they find Captain Hook and his army of Heartless
cutscene.sp: Captain Hook Quite a codfish, that Riku—running off with that girl without even saying goodbye.

cutscene.desc: He waves in the air
cutscene.sp: Sora Run off where? Tell me, where did he go?

cutscene.desc: He swipes at the air with his Keyblade
cutscene.sp: Captain Hook To the ruins of Hollow Bastion, where Maleficent resides. But you won’t be going there.

cutscene.desc: He takes an unlit lantern from Mr. Smee, holding it up. Tinker Bell is trapped inside with her hands on the glass. Sora gasps
cutscene.sp: Captain Hook Unless you intend to leave your little pixie friend behind?

cutscene.desc: He holds his hook up to the lantern scraping the glass with it, scaring Tinker Bell. Sora sighs in exasperation, dispelling the Keyblade. The Pirate Heartless surround them, knives bared
cutscene.sp: Captain Hook Hand over the Keyblade and I’ll spare your lives. Be glad I’m merciful, unlike the Heartless. So, which will it be? The Keyblade, or the plank?

cutscene.desc: He points his hook in the direction of the plank, a wooden board hoisted off the side of the deck. He hears a sound in the air and looks to see a sharp-toothed crocodile in the water, the clock inside its belly ticking away
cutscene.sp: Captain Hook (terrified) It’s him! The crocodile that took me hand! Oh, Smee! He’s after me other hand! I can’t stay here!

cutscene.desc: It stares up at him hungrily
cutscene.sp: Captain Hook Go away! Oh, I can’t stand the sight of him!

cutscene.desc: Hook retreats to his cabin
cutscene.sp: Captain Hook Smee, you take care of them!

cutscene.desc: The Pirate Heartless force Sora onto the plank, who backs slowly towards the ocean. When he reaches the edge of the plank, the crocodile opens its wide mouth and Sora hears Peter Pan’s voice
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan Fly, Sora! Just believe, and you can do it!

cutscene.desc: Sora closes his eyes and leaps backwards off the plank. He descends toward the crocodile, who jumps at him, but at the last second flies into the air over the deck. Peter Pan swoops down and takes Tinker Bell from Smee, who is distracted by Sora. Sora and Peter Pan land on the deck in front of the flabbergasted first mate. Peter Pan opens the lantern, setting Tinker Bell free
cutscene.sp: Sora Thanks, Peter.
Peter Pan Hey, don’t mention it. You didn’t think I’d leave you and Tink behind, did you?

cutscene.desc: Tinker Bell floats down next to them and Smee runs away, leaving them to deal with the Heartless swarming the deck
cutscene.sp: Sora You’re all going down!

cutscene.desc: They start attacking the Heartless on the ship and in the air. Sora holds a hand to his chest and the Keyblade flashes. He throws it into the air and catches it. Magic sparks burst out of the tip of the blade uncontrollably and he loses his grip on it. In a final burst of magic, it creates blue smoke which billows upward. Genie appears inside the smoke with a huge grin on his face. He yells and flexes his muscles, spinning around and giving Sora a high five. Genie targets the surrounding Heartless and shoots them with several magic spells
cutscene.sp: Genie Toodle-oo!

cutscene.desc: He waves and disappears. Once the Heartless are taken care of, Sora and Peter Pan wait outside the Captain’s Hold. Peter knocks on the door with a devilish grin
cutscene.sp: Captain Hook Is that you, Smee? Did you finish them off?

cutscene.desc: Peter laughs silently to himself and pinches his nose to sound like Smee
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan (as Smee) Aye, Captain. They walked the plank, every last one of them.

cutscene.desc: Captain Hook runs out past them and looks around, seeing nobody there, before Peter Pan pokes him with his dagger. Hook shout and jumps into the air, stumbling over his words
cutscene.sp: Captain Hook P-Peter Pa—blast you!

cutscene.desc: He glares at the smiling boy
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan Ready to make a splash, you codfish? Now it’s your turn to talk the plank!

cutscene.desc: He points toward Hook. Battleship Heartless appear in the air, raining down cannon fire on them. Donald and Goofy fly in the air after the Heartless while Sora and Peter Pan go after Hook, who slashes in the air frantically at them
cutscene.sp: Captain Hook Fire!

cutscene.desc: Hook throws a box at Sora, which exploded in his face as Peter Pan charges at him with his dagger. Hook blocks and knocks Peter back
cutscene.sp: Captain Hook (mockingly) Come and get me!

cutscene.desc: Sora slides towards him and attempts to strike with the Keyblade, but Hook jumps back near the rudder. Sora flies up and after him. He sends a Fira spell at the Captain, which sets his trousers on fire, causing him to run around hysterically. He runs over the guardrail of the top deck, and Peter Pan knocks him into the water, making a big splash. He surfaces in front of the crocodile, who opens his mouth happily, his tongue lolling about as he pounces at Captain Hook. The captain runs on the water, screaming, as the crocodile chases him out of sight. Later, Sora stands at the guardrail away from Donald, Goofy, and Peter
cutscene.sp: Goofy Uh, Kairi couldn’t wake up, so maybe she’s really lost her—

cutscene.desc: Goofy puts his hands over his chest
cutscene.sp: Donald Shh!

cutscene.desc: Goofy makes a gulping sound
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan Sora.
Sora I still can’t believe it.

cutscene.desc: He looks into the night sky, smiling
cutscene.sp: Sora I really flew. Wait ‘til I tell Kairi. I wonder if she’ll believe me. Probably not.
Peter Pan You can bring her to Never Land sometime. Then she can try it herself.
Sora If you believe, you can do anything, right? I’ll find Kairi. I know I will. There’s so much I want to tell her—about flying, the pirates, and everything else that’s happened.

cutscene.desc: Tinker Bell flies in and speaks to Peter
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan What’s that, Tink? What about the clock tower? You say there’s something there?

cutscene.desc: They fly off the ship away from Never Land to a quaint city where the moon is shining brightly over the large clock tower. The tower has four faces, a clock on each side. As they approach, a cloaked Heartless flies alongside them. Sora looks over and it stares at him beneath its hood, darkness trailing in the air behind it. They stop and it faces them in front of the tower, gathering magic in its fingers. The numbers of the clock start to glow and the minute hand begins to move forward. Donald sees this and quickly casts stop on the clock. The Phantom Heartless swoops forward and attempts to claw at Sora with its sharp fingers. A bright orb of magical energy appears at the base of the Heartless’s cloak. Sora strikes it with his Keyblade and it turned red in color. Donald shoots a Fira spell at it and it turns blue. Smiling, Donald aims a Blizzara spell, and the orb disappears. The Phantom recoils, enraged. It spins around and releases a dark fireball. Sora tries to fly away but it strikes him in the back. Goofy tosses him a Potion and they continue their magic strategy until the Phantom begins to falter in the air. Its hands cover its stomach, bending over in front of the clock. From beneath its cloak, a heart floats out, and the Phantom falls and fades away. Wendy sits at the clock tower as they fly towards her. She stands up as they land. Soon, the clock strikes midnight and the Keyhole appears, shining bright enough to be seen from a distance, flashing between the 2 and 3 on the clock. Sora aims his Keyblade at it and locks it. It glows and disappears, releasing a gummi block. Meanwhile in Hollow Bastion, Riku’s memories flash through his mind. He recalls the day nearly 9 years ago when he and Sora discovered the Secret Place
cutscene.sp: Riku Hey, Sora.
Sora (looking back at him) Hm?
Riku When we grow up, let’s get off this island. We’ll go on real adventures, not this kid stuff!

cutscene.desc: Riku’s eyes grow wide with anticipation
cutscene.sp: Sora Sure. But isn’t there anything fun to do now? Hey, you know the new girl at the mayor’s house? She arrived on the night of the meteor shower!

cutscene.desc: Sora exits the cave, and Riku follows him, before stopping to look back at the wooden door. A golden Keyhole has appeared on the door and he stares at it in fascination. Riku snaps back into reality, a light from the ceiling casting its glow on him. He is kneeling on the floor, entirely out of breath. He breathes heavily as green torches burn on the walls. Maleficent stands over him, holding her staff strongly, looking down on him with dominating eyes
cutscene.sp: Maleficent (deriding) It was reckless to bring her here without at least using a vessel. Remember, relying too heavily on the dark powers could cost you your heart.

cutscene.desc: A booming roar resounds from outside the castle, causing Riku to stand and look toward the source of the noise. Maleficent smiles
cutscene.sp: Maleficent A castaway.

cutscene.desc: Riku narrows his eyes
cutscene.sp: Maleficent Though his world perished, his heart did not. When we took the princess from his castle, he apparently followed her here through sheer force of will. But fear not. No harm will come to you. He is no match for your power.
Riku My power?
Maleficent Yes, the untapped power that lies within you. Now, child, it’s time you awakened that power and realized your true potential.

cutscene.desc: A green aura surrounds Riku and he feels stronger. Meanwhile, Wendy walks along the clock tower as Peter floats near her
cutscene.sp: Wendy Peter, are you really going back to Never Land?
Peter Pan Afraid so. But we can see each other any time. As long as you don’t forget about Never Land, that is.

cutscene.desc: He floats closer and they hold hands. Tinker Bell sees this and crosses her arms in jealousy. Donald laughs at her until she turns around and glares at him. He clamps his beak shut and the pixie flies over to Peter and Wendy, spinning angry circles around them. Then she does the same to Sora
cutscene.sp: Peter Pan Oh, boy. She’s getting’ steamed again. Do me a favor. Look after her for me, will ya?

cutscene.desc: Tink floats up to Sora and spins around
cutscene.sp: Sora What?

cutscene.desc: Sora talks to Wendy
cutscene.sp: Wendy Peter remains with me as long as I remember him. You will find Kairi if she remains in your heart. You’ll find her Sora. Just don’t give up.

cutscene.desc: Sora, Donald, and Goofy board the gummi ship
cutscene.sp: Donald Well, we found the Navi-Gummi piece. Let’s go back to town.
Sora Cid’ll install it on the ship once we bring it to him.

cutscene.desc: They return to Traverse Town and travel to the First District, where they find Pinocchio and Geppetto in a new house
cutscene.sp: Sora Pinocchio?
Pinocchio Hey, it’s Sora!
Geppetto Well, hello, Sora!
Sora How did you get here?

Geppetto A man named Leon helped us. He even got us this house to live in. I don’t know how I’ll ever repay his kindness. Say, I hear you three are fighting the Heartless. I thought I might be able to help you, so I made this.

cutscene.desc: He gives them a gummi ship blueprint
cutscene.sp: Sora For us?
Geppetto But of course! Pinocchio and I can’t thank you enough! We’ll do anything we can to help you.
Pinocchio I’m being good, even without Jiminy’s help.

cutscene.desc: They leave and speak to Cid in the First District
cutscene.sp: Cid Looks like you found the other one. Let me see it.

cutscene.desc: They hand him the gummi block
cutscene.sp: Cid Okay, wait here. I’ll get it installed right now.

cutscene.desc: As they wait for Cid to modify their ship, Sora stares at the ground sadly
cutscene.sp: Donald Sora!
Goofy Now, just remember what Donald said to ya: no frowning, no sad faces.
Sora How can you be so cheerful? There’s still no sign of your king. Aren’t you worried?
Donald Aw, phooey.
Goofy The king told us to go out and find the key bearer, and we found you. So as long as we stick together, it’ll all work out okay. Ya just gotta believe in yourself, that’s all.
Sora Just believe...

cutscene.desc: Sora closes his eyes and hears a voice
cutscene.sp: Kairi I believe in you.

cutscene.desc: Sora finds himself flying toward a great shining light, which envelops everything. Slowly, a room began to fade in around him, filled with bookshelves and stained glass windows. He floats in the air, watching
cutscene.sp: Sora Where am I?

cutscene.desc: He sees an old woman sitting on a chair under a long staircase. A young girl with red hair runs up to the woman, who smiles down at her
cutscene.sp: Grandmother Long ago, people lived in peace, bathed in the warmth of light. Everyone loved the light. Then people began to fight over it. They wanted to keep it for themselves. And darkness was born in their hearts. The darkness spread, swallowing the light and many people’s hearts. It covered everything, and the world disappeared. But small fragments of light survived...in the hearts of children. With these fragments of light, children rebuilt the lost world. It’s the world we live in now. But the true light sleeps, deep within the darkness. That’s why the worlds are still scattered, divided from each other. But someday, a door to the innermost darkness will open. And the true light will return. So, listen, child. Even in the deepest darkness, there will always be a light to guide you. Believe in the light, and the darkness will never defeat you. Your heart will shine with its power and push the darkness away. Do you understand, Kairi?

cutscene.desc: Sora blinks and the woman disappears
cutscene.sp: Sora Kairi!?

cutscene.desc: He scans the room, seeing no one for a second. Blinking again, he is back floating in the air, seeing the 4 year-old Kairi, who looks around. He bends forward, trying to reach her, but she disappears and he is thrown back to reality
cutscene.sp: Sora (shocked) Huh?
Goofy What’s the matter?
Sora Um, nothing. Kairi... Did you call me?

cutscene.desc: Cid walks back to them
cutscene.sp: Cid I installed that navigation gummi. But, ya know? That place is crawling with Heartless. Don’t say I didn’t warn you.

cutscene.desc: Sora looks confused
cutscene.sp: Cid Here, take this along.

cutscene.desc: He gives them a gummi block. They leave for the Olympus Coliseum and compete in the Hercules Cup. They reach the final match with Hercules
cutscene.sp: Hercules Show me what you’ve got!
Sora Hercules, wait. Let’s go one-on-one!
Donald Oh, brother. What a show-off.
Goofy What’re we gonna do?
Donald Let him go alone, I guess.
Goofy Good luck, Sora!
Hercules I’m not gonna go easy on you!

cutscene.desc: Sora fights and defeats Hercules, winning a trophy. Phil dances on the steps of the arena as Sora smiles at Donald and Goofy, holding the trophy in his hands. They return to the Vestibule
cutscene.sp: Hercules Wow! And I didn’t even hold back!
Sora Now I finally know what you mean about strength of heart. Mine comes from Donald and Goofy.
Philoctetes Come again?
Sora If we stick together, we’re unbeatable. Not even Hercules stands a chance.

cutscene.desc: Hercules smiles
cutscene.sp: Sora With these guys beside me, I’m ready for anything!
Philoctetes But that’s not exactly what I—
Hercules (picking Phil up) Of course. Your friends give you strength. Isn’t that right, Phil? The three of you together make great heroes.

cutscene.desc: He puts Phil back down
cutscene.sp: Hercules And as a team, I’m sure you can overcome anything.

cutscene.desc: Sora and Hercules slam their hands together. Sora, Donald, and Goofy push the pedestal in the room over to reveal the Keyhole in the floor. Sora stands in front of it and holds his Keyblade up. The blade glows and the Keyhole is sealed. Sora talks to Hercules
cutscene.sp: Hercules Phil wasn’t happy that I lost to you. Said I was getting soft. You beat me last time, but next time won’t be so easy.

cutscene.desc: They leave the Olympus Coliseum and travel to the next world. They disembark on a tiled platform in the middle of a raging waterfall. Strangely, the waterfalls seem to be going upward. Goofy points further ahead, past the waterfalls
cutscene.sp: Goofy Gawrsh, look at that!
Sora I know this place...

cutscene.desc: They walk closer and gaze up at Hollow Bastion, a ruined castle, twisted by the darkness inhabiting the world for so long
cutscene.sp: Goofy Hmm, that’s strange.
Sora I wonder why... I feel this warmth inside, right here.

cutscene.desc: He places his hand on his chest
cutscene.sp: Donald Aw, you’re just hungry.
Sora Hey, I’m serious!

cutscene.desc: A loud roar erupts from further ahead, startling them
cutscene.sp: Sora Let’s go!

cutscene.desc: They travel along the crystalline platforms toward the origin of the sound. Above on a platform with a stone arch, Riku is confronting a figure in a violet cloak. From the hairy claws and tail protruding from the bottom of the cloak, it was undeniably animal
